visual.name: calendarProByOKVIZ
visual.description: Calendar Pro by OKVIZ is a powerful calendar for Power BI.

dataRoles.description: (Optional) Set the main measure used to define cell colors and labels.
dataRoles.name: value

dataRoles.description: (Optional) Set additional measure(s) to use with color rules.
dataRoles.name: colorRuleValues

dataRoles.description: (Optional) Set the column or measures that define the events. Limitation: 1 column or N measures.
dataRoles.name: events

dataRoles.description: (Optional) Set the countries (ISO) to use to display holidays. If you don't set any measure here, you can still set multiple static countries by using the Holidays panel.
dataRoles.name: holidaysCountries

dataRoles.description: (Optional) Set additional measures to display in tooltips.
dataRoles.name: tooltips

invertAxis.description: Invert the axes of the chart. It's limited to: Hours by Day/Month/Quarter, and Months By Quarter.

leapRule.description: An additional week must be appended to week calendars (364-day long) to catch up for leap years and missing days. Choose how to calculate it.

leapAppend.description: Choose the month where to append the extra week.

leapYears.description: Choose when to append the extra week.

leapStart.description: Choose the year from which start counting.

monthEndDay.description: If you set a number longer than the month size, days from the next one will be included to fit in. If you leave blank, the last day of the month as defined by the Gregorian calendar is used.

yearEndWeekday.description: How to choose the last weekday of the year? E.g.: If your week starts on Sunday, then the last weekday is Saturday. With 'Last of the year' the fiscal year ends on the last Saturday of the last month. Otherwise, the fiscal year ends on the Saturday closest to the last day of the last month - it could be on the next year.

weekStart.description: Choose the first weekday of each week. For fiscal and weekly calendars (4-4-5, 4-5-4, 5-4-4) this option doesn't impact only the layout of the calender, but also define the first day of each month.

completeYears.description: Make the calendar displaying complete years also if the data interval starts/ends from/to different dates.

defaultToday.description: Sets the initial period displayed by the calendar to that which includes today's date. If not set, the initial period is the last selected period. This option works only if the calendar interval includes today's date.

granularity.description: Define what entities are considered as cell.

allGranularities.description: Allow users to see all granularities. Disable it to choose which granularities to exclude.

blankFill.description: Set the static color of the cell when it contains no data. This option can be overridden by data color and advanced color rules.

fill.description: Set the base color of the cell when it contains data. This option can be overridden by advanced color rules.

weekendFill.description: Set the static color of the cell for weekend days. This option overrides advanced color rules.

todayFill.description: Set the static color of the cell for today. This option overrides the advanced color rules.

extendTodayFill.description: Extend the Today color option to any granularity, e.g. the month, the quarter, the current year.

join.description: When the same event spans across different adjacent days, it is displayed as a single one. It applies only to column events when event's start/end time is not defined.

aggregate.description: Assign a single to every event. Turn off to assign different colors according to the source event field.

enumeration.displayName: Cộng hòa Xã hội chủ nghĩa Việt Nam
Cộng hòa Xã hội chủ nghĩa Việt Nam
Cộng hòa Xã hội chủ nghĩa Việt Nam

native.description: Display the native holiday names. If disabled, the names may be translated according to the selected localization.

showOnDaysOnly.description: Show holidays when data is grouped by Day only.

showAll.description: Disable to choose what kind of holidays to display.

showBank.description: When banks and offices are closed.

showObservance.description: When the majority of people take a day off.

showOptional.description: Optional festivity, no paid day off.

showLabelFlag.description: Display the flag(s) of the country where the holiday is celebrated on the labels.

auto.description: Determine the localization by using your current browser/OS settings.

userLocale.description: Set the culture code in the format languageCode-countryCode.

autoHide.description: Hide the toolbar when the cursor is not over the visual.

jumpControls.description: Show a control to quick jump to a specific date or interval.

granularityControls.description: Allow users to dynamically change the granularity of the calendar.

granularityZoom.description: Allow users to enter zoom mode.

focusViewControl.description: Allow users to toggle the focus view mode.

focusOnZoom.description: Switch to focus view when zoom on a cell.

tableEditControl.description: Allow users to change the layout of the calendar (number of rows and columns).

labels.description: Show a visual indication of the current granularity and grouping.

groupingControls.description: Allow users to dynamically change the dates grouping.

clear.description: Show a button to quickly clear the current selection.

maxTooltipItems.description: Limit the number of items to display in tooltips. Set 0 or blank to show all.

hide.description: Disable the Advanced Editor button that appears in the right corner of the visual. When disabled, you can still access the editor's advanced features by clicking the 'Edit' item in the menu from the visual header.

maxData.description: Choose how many rows to retrieve from the data source. Please note that retrieving more than 30K rows may slow down the entire report. Set 0 or blank to retrieve all.

aggregate.description: Define how to aggregate values when the granularity of the calendar is different from the granularity of the underlying data model or when there are multiple data points for the same date.

diagnostics.description: Log significant information and errors in the script console of the browser. This could affect the performance of your report.
